title.native: 艦隊これくしょん -艦これ-

description:
Set in a world where humanity has lost control of the oceans to the “deep sea fleet,” the only hope to counter this threat are the Kanmusu, a group of girls who possess the spirit of Japanese warships. The story revolves around Fubuki, a destroyer who comes to the Chinjufu base to train with other Kanmusu. Watch as their stories unfold!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

node.description: Kusakawa Keizou is a storyboarder and director working for [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs). During his early years at the studio he has worked under [Shinbou Akiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/Akiyuki-Shinbou) and has since then been also involved in several shows directed by Shinbou at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft). Kusakawa also took over the duties as director of the Lyrical Nanoha series from Shinbou after he left Seven Arcs, starting with its second season, Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀山俊樹)
[Website](http://kameokanatsumi.com/)

**[Website](https://exina.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/EXiNA_XiENA)** | **[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/exinaofficial/)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/shiena-nishizawa/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/exina_xiena/)** | **[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKUR1GWKBZbFByLoPeRxDtA)** | **[Artist Page (Flying Dog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A024998.html)**

**Introduction:**
Shiena Nishizawa, alternatively known by stage name EXiNA, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer. She debuted under record label flying DOG after winning the grand prize at the label's first audition, she is now under record label [SACRA MUSIC](http://sacramusic.jp/artist/) (which is under Sony Music Entertainment).

**Biography:**
In junior high school, she became immersed in music when she received her father's guitar as a gift. She dreamed that one that she would sing in front of a large number of people as an artist, and in 2014 she won the grand prize at the "First flying DOG Audition". In 2015 she performed the ending theme song to the TV anime *"[Kantai Collection: Kancolle](https://anilist.co/anime/20553/Kantai-Collection-KanColle)"*, which was also her debut as a musician. 

Shiena announed a solo project on July 9, 2019, going from using her real name Shiena Nishizawa to adopting a new stage name EXiNA (which is an anagram of her given name Shiena = EXiNA). Her first release as EXiNA was a digital single released on July 10, 2019 titled 'EQ'. She went on to release a second digital single on August 3, 2019 titled 'KATANA', and then followed-up by releasing her third single on August 14, 2019 titled 'OVERTHINKING BOY'. Her first mini-album was released on August 21, 2019 titled 'XiX', which was also her first album-like release under her new stage name.

(Source: [generasia.com](http://www.generasia.com/wiki/Nishizawa_Shiena) | [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%A5%BF%E6%B2%A2%E5%B9%B8%E5%A5%8F), edited)

**Height:** 163cm

Akino Kawamitsu, better known by her stage name AKINO, is an American-born Japanese pop singer, from Utah. Originally debuting in 2003 with her brothers Akashi and Aiki and her sister Kanasa in the band bless4, Akino made her solo debut in 2005 singing the opening themes of the TV anime Sousei no Aquarion. Her debut album "Lost in Time" was released in 2007 under her new stage name, AKINO from bless4. All of her songs are composed by Yoko Kanno.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._
Affiliated with [diomedéa](https://anilist.co/studio/51/diomeda).

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise (2010-2022), Aoni Production (2022-present)

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/sakura-ayane.html) | [Blog (old)](http://www.joqr.co.jp/blog/sakura/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayane.sakura.mg/)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Nearl - Arknights (VG)
- Yae Miko - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Yae Sakura - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Julia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

- Devonica - Ohsama Sentai King-Ohger: Adventure Heaven (Movie)
- Rio Sonogami - Date a Live: Rio Reincarnation (VG)
- Prinz Eugen - Azur Lane (VG)

__Height:__ 150 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nomizuiori) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nomizuiorichan/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@nomizuiorichan/videos) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/nomizuiori1018/)

__Height:__ 152 cm
__Agency:__ Intention 

[Artist Profile](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Profile/A023615.html) | [Official Site](http://toyamanao.com/) | [Official Club](http://fc.toyamanao.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/toyamanao/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/naobou_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/naobou_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/naobou_channel) | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nao_T%C5%8Dyama) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%B1%E5%B1%B1%E5%A5%88%E5%A4%AE)

__Radio Programs:__
- (2014-2017) Touyama Nao's Dream * Theater
- (2017-) Touyama Nao's Radio @ Living

__Awards:__ 
- (2019-03-09) Best Supporting Actress Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- (2019-03-09) Game Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards

__Early Life & Education__
She was born in Tokyo on March 11, 1992. Her father had spent 9 years abroad and was fluent in English, which allowed her to develop fluency in the language. From an early age she had an interest in anime, in particular the series _Ojamajo Doremi_ and _Sailor Moon_. However, it was the anime series _Fullmetal Alchemist_ that was the first to inspire her to become a voice actress. At the time, she was impressed that the series' protagonist Edward Elric was voiced by a female actress, [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/Romi-Park).

In junior high school and high school, she became part of a chorus club to help her overcome her tone deafness. It was also during this time she decided to pursue a voice acting career as she had interacted with schoolmates who had similar interests. Her parents approved of her decision, provided that she pass her university entrance exams. 

__Voice Acting Career__
While in high school, she began attending the Japan Narration Acting Institute. After 3 years of training, she passed her audition and joined the agency Arts Vision. At the same time, she also passed her entrance exam and began studying at Waseda University. She debuted as a voice actress in 2010 and later that year she played her first main role in the anime series _The World God Only Knows_. Throughout her 4 years in University, she continued to work as a voice actress, successfully managing both her work and school responsibilities. She graduated in March 2014 and left Art Vision shortly after on April 1. On May 1, 2014, she transferred to the agency Intention and is currently affiliated with them today.

__Music Career__
Her music career began when she released songs for _The World God Only Knows_ under her character name Kanon Nakagawa. In 2013, she became part of the music group Rhodanthe*, which performed theme songs for the _Kiniro Mosaic_ series. After having been cast in 2015, she has also released singles as her Idolmaster character Mizuki Kawashima. In 2016, she voiced a member of the in-universe music group Walküre, which performed songs for the anime series _Macross Δ_.

In 2017, she made her solo debut as a singer on February 1 with the release of her single "True Destiny" / "Chain the World" under the Flying Dog label. Later that year, her second single "Ima Koko" / "Tsuki ga Kirei" was released on May 24 as well as her first album _Rainbow_ on October 25. In 2018, she held her first solo live event at the Nippon Budokan on February 3 and released her third single "Tomoshibi no Manima ni" on May 30. In 2019, she released her second album _Gunjou Infinity_ on April 3. During the months of August and September, she held her first tour live event performing in the cities of Osaka, Nagoya, and Yokohama as well as cities outside of Japan like Taipei and Shanghai. In 2020, her fourth single "Aruite Ikou!" is set to release on February 5.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Misono Mika in "Blue Archive" (VG)
- Mualani in "Genshin Impact" (VG)
- Juna Crawford - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uesaka_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uesaka_sumire) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/uesakasumire) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/uesaka_sumire/) | [Record Label Profile](http://king-cr.jp/artist/uesakasumire/)

Sumire entered the entertainment industry at the age of 9, when she was scouted by Space Craft's junior talent division. In 2009, she landed her first regular radio gig as host of Web Raji@Dengeki Bunko, and in 2011, she transferred to animation division of Space Craft due her interest in becoming a voice actress. On March 12, 2016, Sumire received the Best Rookie Actress award in the 10th Seiyuu Awards. She has also been a member of the seiyuu unit ".lady." since 2014.

Sumire is fluent in Russian and loves the Soviet culture, which she became interested in after hearing the State Anthem of the USSR in her first year of high school. In April 2010, Sumire entered the Faculty of Foreign Studies at Sophia University, and she majored in the Russian language there.

Sumire is interested in history and war figurines, particularly Russian/Soviet history, the Showa era, and likes the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms. She also has had a strong interest in games, anime and manga ever since she was a child. Her other interests consists of photography, lolita fashion-- she works as a lolita model-- and drawing, which she is quite good at. She also loves rock and heavy metal; her favorite bands are Metallica, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Dragonforce, and Kinniku Shoujo Tai. Additionally, Sumire is very good friends with fellow seiyuu [Sachika Misawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102337/Sachika-Misawa), who has called Sumire "her waifu".

**Non-anime roles:**
- Rosalie - Memento Mori (VG)
- Exia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Drake - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

__Birth Name:__ Sakiko Fujita (藤田咲子)

[Blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/sakky-ohana) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakitaf_1019)

She is best known in Japan for sampling her voice for the Vocaloid, Hatsune Miku.

__Height:__ 157 cm
__Agency:__ Office Osawa

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Official Website](https://www.cliffordchapin.com/) l [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cliffordchapin)

Clifford Samuel Chapin IV is an American voice actor and director at Funimation.

Chapin is known for his roles in anime and video games, such as Ichijo Takayanagi from Red Data Girl, Connie Springer from Attack on Titan, Shingo Wakamoto from Prison School, Kukulkan in Smite, Hideyoshi Nagachika from Tokyo Ghoul, Yuri Dreyar from Fairy Tail, and Katsuki Bakugo from My Hero Academia. Chapin won the VNs Now award Best Male VA of 2013 for his role of David Sawicki in Yousei by Sakevisual. He also worked as a production assistant for Toddlers and Tiaras, NBC Nightly News, Disaster Guy, and The Rolling Girls. In 2014, Chapin landed the lead voice role of Raishin Akabane in Unbreakable Machine-Doll. In 2015, he voiced the lead character Harutora Tsuchimikado in Tokyo Ravens.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tnks_staff)

Kensuke Tanaka, also known informally as "Tanaka" amongst the playerbase, is the creator and original programmer of the Kantai Collection (KanColle) franchise. He is also part of C2.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tnks_staff)

Current president of [diomedéa](https://anilist.co/studio/51/diomeda) since 2006. Makoto Kohara was formerly an animator at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft) and trained animators such as [Mai Ootsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/103975/Mai-Ootsuka). He is still occasionally active as a director and animator.
